metadata.title: A potential role for integrins in host cell entry by SARS-CoV-2
metadata.author: Christian JA Sigrist, Alan Bridge, Philippe Le Mercier

introduction: Integrin may act as an alternative receptor for SARS-CoV-2 and could be implicated in its transmission and pathology.
The spike protein of SARS-CoV-2 acquired a RGD motif known to bind integrins. This motif is absent from other coronaviruses.

summary: Integrin may act as an alternative receptor for SARS-CoV-2 and could be implicated in its transmission and pathology.
The spike protein of SARS-CoV-2 acquired a RGD motif known to bind integrins.
This motif is absent from other coronaviruses.
The integrin-binding motif is present at the surface of the spike protein, close to the ACE2 receptor-binding region.
Integrin binding may be a promising therapeutics target, and should be tested experimentally.
